While FIDIC Red Book is a widely used standard construction contract, I wanted to review it thoroughly to better understand the Conditions of Contract.

 

Please refer to my comments in the attached version. I understand that these conditions were introduced by HCO on our behalf as they tend to be more favorable to us as the client, however I would still prefer you and 3D team to review and confirm, particularly the sections I highlighted in yellow.

 

Regarding the paying entity, I have checked with local accounting team, and it is confirmed that the agreement should be made directly with SILZ entity. Any necessary funds will be injected by CGA through SILZ entity as it is the sole owner. Looping in @Zaher <mailto:Md.zaher.Tayara@chalhoub.com>  and @Omar <mailto:Omar.Zaouiri@chalhoub.com>  for their info.

 

Please let me know if you have any concerns.

 

Best,

Sayed Adnan

Dear Mitar,

 

Apologies for the delay.

 

While FIDIC Red Book is a widely used standard construction contract, I wanted to review it thoroughly to better understand the Conditions of Contract.

 

Please refer to my comments in the attached version. I understand that these conditions were introduced by HCO on our behalf as they tend to be more favorable to us as the client, however I would still prefer you and 3D team to review and confirm, particularly the sections I highlighted in yellow.

 

Regarding the paying entity, I have checked with local accounting team, and it is confirmed that the agreement should be made directly with SILZ entity. Any necessary funds will be injected by CGA through SILZ entity as it is the sole owner. Looping in @Zaher <mailto:Md.zaher.Tayara@chalhoub.com>  and @Omar <mailto:Omar.Zaouiri@chalhoub.com>  for their info.

Best,

Dear Hagop,

 

Thak you for your time today. 

 

Attached are the latest comments from the General Contractor – Amana, on the CoC.

 

Thank you for providing your feedback on the key areas requiring resolution are as follows:

a. Insurances:

•            Confirmation is required from the Client regarding the coverage limit being set as an aggregate.

•            If CAR (Contractor’s All Risk) insurance is provided, TPL (Third Party Liability) insurance may not be necessary, as CAR typically includes third-party coverage – To be confirmed by the Client.

•            The requirement for IDI (Inherent Defects Insurance) is not included in our offer and is not mandated by law, do we really need it?  – To be confirmed by the Client.

 

Final meeting with Amana is on Wednesday morning, so highly appreciated if you provide your feedback by tomorrow.

 

Best Regards,

 

mitar jokanovic​​​​

Thank you for providing your feedback on the key areas requiring resolution are as follows:

a. Insurances:

•            Confirmation is required from the Client regarding the coverage limit being set as an aggregate.

Final meeting with Amana is on Wednesday morning, so highly appreciated if you provide your feedback by tomorrow.

 

Best Regards,

Dear Hagop,

 

Thak you for your time today. 

 

Attached are the latest comments from the General Contractor – Amana, on the CoC.

 

Thank you for providing your feedback on the key areas requiring resolution are as follows:

a. Insurances:

•            Confirmation is required from the Client regarding the coverage limit being set as an aggregate.

•            If CAR (Contractor’s All Risk) insurance is provided, TPL (Third Party Liability) insurance may not be necessary, as CAR typically includes third-party coverage – To be confirmed by the Client.

•            The requirement for IDI (Inherent Defects Insurance) is not included in our offer and is not mandated by law, do we really need it?  – To be confirmed by the Client.

 

Final meeting with Amana is on Wednesday morning, so highly appreciated if you provide your feedback by tomorrow.

 

Best Regards,
